CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1959, pg. B6, reads: "Planning Salute to Carver - A committee of prominent Pittsburghers, which met recently to draft plans for the local observance of George Washington Carver Week, Jan. 3-9, 1960, included, front row, left to right: Mrs. Goldie Hamilton, Dr. H. O. Pregler, Miss Marie A. Saul, Mrs. Alma Illery; second row: H. H. Henius, Dr. Iris L. Fike, Mmes. W. J. Moncrief, Irene Hoggans and W. C. Eichenlaub. G. Harold Griffin is standing in rear. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, seated from left: Goldie Hamilton, Dr. H. O. Pregler, Marie A. Saul, Alma Illery; standing: H. H. Henius, Dr. Iris L. Fike, W. J. Moncrief, G. Harold Griffin, Irene Hoggans, and W. C. Eichenlaub, posed in art classroom
